intro: Bradea borrerioides, commonly known as the Mexican bradea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
